    Calculate an individual's cancer density probabilities

    calcCancerDens.Rd

    Calculates the cancer density functions for an individual.

    calcCancerDens(
  ID,
  affages,
  cancers,
  sub_dens,
  PGs,
  direct_fill_PGs,
  multi_PGs,
  multi_muts
)

    Arguments

    ID

    Unique ID corresponding to an ID in sub_dens.

    affages

    Individual ID's (non-missing) ages of affection corresponding to cancers.

    cancers

    A vector of cancer names for cancers that individual ID developed at affages.

    sub_dens

    A numeric array of subsetted cancer penetrances returned by subsetCancerPenetrance.

    PGs

    Possible genotypes in both list and data frame format, returned by .getPossibleGenotype.

    direct_fill_PGs

    A vector of genotype names with no more than 1 mutation (including "noncarrier"), corresponding to PGs.

    multi_PGs

    A vector of genotype names with 2 or more simultaneous mutations, corresponding to PGs.

    multi_muts

    A list where each component corresponds to a genotype in multi_PGs, represented as a vector of gene names to indicate the mutations. mutations, corresponding to PGs.

    Value

    A numeric vector with length equal to the number of possible genotypes. Each element corresponds to the probability that individual ID

    develops the cancers at their corresponding affages, given a possible genotype in PGs. If cancers is an empty vector, 1 will be returned.

    Contents

    Developed by BayesMendel Lab, Theo Huang, Gavin Lee, Jane Liang, Tom Madsen, Qing Zhang.

    Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
